p: The five most abundant bee species across both native and non‐native plant plots were A. mellifera, H. poeyi/ligatus, X. virginica, B. impatiens, and Lasioglossum pilosum, in order of decreasing abundance (Table S1). Xylocopa virginica, B. impatiens, and L. pilosum showed a more specialized foraging behavior at native than at non‐native plants (Figure 6 and Table 4). Apis mellifera became less specialized over the entire flowering season with the highest specialization early in the year and lowest specialization later in the year (Figure 6 and Table 4). The other species' specificity remained similar across seasons, but X. virginica and B. impatiens were absent in the early season (Figure 6 and Table 4).
